rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #AngleDegrees
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Measurement of angle in degrees.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #ApparentPower
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Product of the RMS value of the voltage and the RMS value of the current.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #Asset
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Tangible resource of the utility, including power system equipment, various end devices, cabinets, buildings, etc. For electrical network equipment, the role of the asset is defined through PowerSystemResource and its subclasses, defined mainly in the Wires model (refer to IEC61970-301 and model package IEC61970::Wires). Asset description places emphasis on the physical characteristics of the equipment fulfilling that role.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #AssetInfo
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Set of attributes of an asset, representing typical datasheet information of a physical device that can be instantiated and shared in different data exchange contexts: - as attributes of an asset instance (installed or in stock) - as attributes of an asset model (product by a manufacturer) - as attributes of a type asset (generic type of an asset as used in designs/extension planning).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #BaseVoltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Defines a system base voltage which is referenced.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #ChangeSetMember
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A CRUD-style data object.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #ClearanceDocument
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Safety document used to authorise work on conducting equipment in the field. Tagged equipment is not allowed to be operated.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #Conductance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Factor by which voltage must be multiplied to give corresponding power lost from a circuit. Real part of admittance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #ConductingEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that are conductively connected through terminals.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #ConfigurationEvent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Used to report details on creation, change or deletion of an entity or its configuration.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #ContingencyEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Equipment whose in service status is to change, such as a power transformer or AC line segment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #Control
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Control is used for supervisory/device control. It represents control outputs that are used to change the state in a process, e.g. close or open breaker, a set point value or a raise lower command.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #CurrentFlow
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electrical current with sign convention: positive flow is out of the conducting equipment into the connectivity node. Can be both AC and DC.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #DiagramObject
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An object that defines one or more points in a given space. This object can be associated with anything that specializes IdentifiedObject. For single line diagrams such objects typically include such items as analog values, breakers, disconnectors, power transformers, and transmission lines.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #EquipmentContainer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A modelling construct to provide a root class for containing equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #EquipmentLimitSeriesComponent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This represents one instance of an equipment that contributes to the calculation of an operational limit.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #Fault
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Abnormal condition causing current flow through conducting equipment, such as caused by equipment failure or short circuits from objects not typically modelled (for example, a tree falling on a line).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #GenericAction
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An arbitrary switching step.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #GroundAction
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Action on ground as a switching step.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #InstanceSet
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Instance of a version of a model part. This corresponds to a payload of instance data.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #JumperAction
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Action on jumper as a switching step.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #LimitDependency
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A limit calculation model used to compute an operational limit based on external input such as temperature. These are intended to be shared among operational limits with the same calculation form that apply to a piece of equipment..

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #Location
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The place, scene, or point of something where someone or something has been, is, and/or will be at a given moment in time. It can be defined with one or more position points (coordinates) in a given coordinate system.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #Measurement
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A Measurement represents any measured, calculated or non-measured non-calculated quantity. Any piece of equipment may contain Measurements, e.g. a substation may have temperature measurements and door open indications, a transformer may have oil temperature and tank pressure measurements, a bay may contain a number of power flow measurements and a Breaker may contain a switch status measurement. The PSR - Measurement association is intended to capture this use of Measurement and is included in the naming hierarchy based on EquipmentContainer. The naming hierarchy typically has Measurements as leaves, e.g. Substation-VoltageLevel-Bay-Switch-Measurement. Some Measurements represent quantities related to a particular sensor location in the network, e.g. a voltage transformer (VT) or potential transformer (PT) at a busbar or a current transformer (CT) at the bar between a breaker and an isolator. The sensing position is not captured in the PSR - Measurement association. Instead it is captured by the Measurement - Terminal association that is used to define the sensing location in the network topology. The location is defined by the connection of the Terminal to ConductingEquipment. If both a Terminal and PSR are associated, and the PSR is of type ConductingEquipment, the associated Terminal should belong to that ConductingEquipment instance. When the sensor location is needed both Measurement-PSR and Measurement-Terminal are used. The Measurement-Terminal association is never used alone.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #Name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Name class provides the means to define any number of human readable names for an object. A name is not to be used for defining inter-object relationships. For inter-object relationships instead use the object identification 'mRID'.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #OperatingShare
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specifies the operations contract relationship between a power system resource and a contract participant.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #OperationalLimitSet
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A set of limits associated with equipment. Sets of limits might apply to a specific temperature, or season for example. A set of limits may contain different severities of limit levels that would apply to the same equipment. The set may contain limits of different types such as apparent power and current limits or high and low voltage limits that are logically applied together as a set.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #OperationalRestriction
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document that can be associated with equipment to describe any sort of restrictions compared with the original manufacturer's specification or with the usual operational practice e.g. temporary maximum loadings, maximum switching current, do not operate if bus couplers are open, etc. In the UK, for example, if a breaker or switch ever mal-operates, this is reported centrally and utilities use their asset systems to identify all the installed devices of the same manufacturer's type. They then apply operational restrictions in the operational systems to warn operators of potential problems. After appropriate inspection and maintenance, the operational restrictions may be removed.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #OperationalTag
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Operational tag placed on a power system resource or asset in the context of switching plan execution or other work in the field.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #Outage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Document describing details of an active or planned outage in a part of the electrical network. A non-planned outage may be created upon: - a breaker trip, - a fault indicator status change, - a meter event indicating customer outage, - a reception of one or more customer trouble calls, or - an operator command, reflecting information obtained from the field crew. Outage restoration may be performed using a switching plan which complements the outage information with detailed switching activities, including the relationship to the crew and work. A planned outage may be created upon: - a request for service, maintenance or construction work in the field, or - an operator-defined outage for what-if/contingency network analysis.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #PSREvent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Event recording the change in operational status of a power system resource; may be for an event that has already occurred or for a planned activity.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #PSRType
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Classifying instances of the same class, e.g. overhead and underground ACLineSegments. This classification mechanism is intended to provide flexibility outside the scope of this document, i.e. provide customisation that is non standard.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #PerCent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Percentage on a defined base. For example, specify as 100 to indicate at the defined base.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #PhaseTapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A transformer phase shifting tap model that controls the phase angle difference across the power transformer and potentially the active power flow through the power transformer. This phase tap model may also impact the voltage magnitude.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #PinEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Value associated with Equipment is used as compare.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #PowerTransformer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An electrical device consisting of two or more coupled windings, with or without a magnetic core, for introducing mutual coupling between electric circuits. Transformers can be used to control voltage and phase shift (active power flow). A power transformer may be composed of separate transformer tanks that need not be identical. A power transformer can be modelled with or without tanks and is intended for use in both balanced and unbalanced representations. A power transformer typically has two terminals, but may have one (grounding), three or more terminals. The inherited association ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage should not be used. The association from TransformerEnd to BaseVoltage should be used instead.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerTransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The ends of this power transformer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerTanks
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All transformers that belong to this bank.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingCurrent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The highest operating current (Ib in IEC 60909-0) before short circuit (depends on network configuration and relevant reliability philosophy). It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KT defined in IEC 60909-0.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingVoltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The highest operating voltage (Ub in IEC 60909-0) before short circuit. It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KT defined in IEC 60909-0. This is worst case voltage on the low side winding (3.7.1 of IEC 60909:2001). Used to define operating conditions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: beforeShortCircuitAnglePf
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The angle of power factor before short circuit (phib in IEC 60909-0). It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KT defined in IEC 60909-0. This is the worst case power factor. Used to define operating conditions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: highSideMinOperatingU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The minimum operating voltage (uQmin in IEC 60909-0) at the high voltage side (Q side) of the unit transformer of the power station unit. A value well established from long-term operating experience of the system. It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KG defined in IEC 60909-0.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: isPartOfGeneratorUnit
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates whether the machine is part of a power station unit. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909. It has an impact on how the correction factors are calculated for transformers, since the transformer is not necessarily part of a synchronous machine and generating unit. It is not always possible to derive this information from the model. This is why the attribute is necessary.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: operationalValuesConsidered
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: It is used to define if the data (other attributes related to short circuit data exchange) defines long term operational conditions or not. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: vectorGroup
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
Vector group of the transformer for protective relaying, e.g., Dyn1. For unbalanced transformers, this may not be simply determined from the constituent winding connections and phase angle displacements.
The vectorGroup string consists of the following components in the order listed: high voltage winding connection, mid voltage winding connection (for three winding transformers), phase displacement clock number from 0 to 11, low voltage winding connection phase displacement clock number from 0 to 11. The winding connections are D (delta), Y (wye), YN (wye with neutral), Z (zigzag), ZN (zigzag with neutral), A (auto transformer). Upper case means the high voltage, lower case mid or low. The high voltage winding always has clock position 0 and is not included in the vector group string. Some examples: YNy0 (two winding wye to wye with no phase displacement), YNd11 (two winding wye to delta with 330 degrees phase displacement), YNyn0d5 (three winding transformer wye with neutral high voltage, wye with neutral mid voltage and no phase displacement, delta low voltage with 150 degrees displacement).
Phase displacement is defined as the angular difference between the phasors representing the voltages between the neutral point (real or imaginary) and the corresponding terminals of two windings, a positive sequence voltage system being applied to the high-voltage terminals, following each other in alphabetical sequence if they are lettered, or in numerical sequence if they are numbered: the phasors are assumed to rotate in a counter-clockwise sense.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #PowerTransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A PowerTransformerEnd is associated with each Terminal of a PowerTransformer. The impedance values r, r0, x, and x0 of a PowerTransformerEnd represents a star equivalent as follows. 1) for a two Terminal PowerTransformer the high voltage (TransformerEnd.endNumber=1) PowerTransformerEnd has non zero values on r, r0, x, and x0 while the low voltage (TransformerEnd.endNumber=2) PowerTransformerEnd has zero values for r, r0, x, and x0. Parameters are always provided, even if the PowerTransformerEnds have the same rated voltage. In this case, the parameters are provided at the PowerTransformerEnd which has TransformerEnd.endNumber equal to 1. 2) for a three Terminal PowerTransformer the three PowerTransformerEnds represent a star equivalent with each leg in the star represented by r, r0, x, and x0 values. 3) For a three Terminal transformer each PowerTransformerEnd shall have g, g0, b and b0 values corresponding to the no load losses distributed on the three PowerTransformerEnds. The total no load loss shunt impedances may also be placed at one of the PowerTransformerEnds, preferably the end numbered 1, having the shunt values on end 1. This is the preferred way. 4) for a PowerTransformer with more than three Terminals the PowerTransformerEnd impedance values cannot be used. Instead use the TransformerMeshImpedance or split the transformer into multiple PowerTransformers. Each PowerTransformerEnd must be contained by a PowerTransformer. Because a PowerTransformerEnd (or any other object) can not be contained by more than one parent, a PowerTransformerEnd can not have an association to an EquipmentContainer (Substation, VoltageLevel, etc).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerTransformer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The power transformer of this power transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: b
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetizing branch susceptance (B mag). The value can be positive or negative.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: b0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence magnetizing branch susceptance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: connectionKind
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Kind of connection.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: g
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetizing branch conductance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: g0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence magnetizing branch conductance (star-model).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: phaseAngleClock
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Terminal voltage phase angle displacement where 360 degrees are represented with clock hours. The valid values are 0 to 11. For example, for the secondary side end of a transformer with vector group code of 'Dyn11', specify the connection kind as wye with neutral and specify the phase angle of the clock as 11. The clock value of the transformer end number specified as 1, is assumed to be zero. Note the transformer end number is not assumed to be the same as the terminal sequence number.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Resistance (star-model) of the transformer end. The attribute shall be equal to or greater than zero for non-equivalent transformers.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence series resistance (star-model) of the transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ratedS
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Normal apparent power rating. The attribute shall be a positive value. For a two-winding transformer the values for the high and low voltage sides shall be identical.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ratedU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Rated voltage: phase-phase for three-phase windings, and either phase-phase or phase-neutral for single-phase windings. A high voltage side, as given by TransformerEnd.endNumber, shall have a ratedU that is greater than or equal to ratedU for the lower voltage sides. The attribute shall be a positive value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence series reactance (star-model) of the transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence series reactance of the transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #ProtectionEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An electrical device designed to respond to input conditions in a prescribed manner and after specified conditions are met to cause contact operation or similar abrupt change in associated electric control circuits, or simply to display the detected condition. Protection equipment is associated with conducting equipment and usually operate circuit breakers.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #ProtectiveActionAdjustment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Protective actions on non-switching equipment. The operating condition is adjusted.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #ProtectiveActionEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Protective action to put an Equipment in-service/out-of-service.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #RatioTapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
A tap changer that changes the voltage ratio impacting the voltage magnitude but not the phase angle across the transformer.
Angle sign convention (general): Positive value indicates a positive phase shift from the winding where the tap is located to the other winding (for a two-winding transformer).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RatioTapChangerTable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The tap ratio table for this ratio tap changer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Transformer end to which this ratio tap changer belongs.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: stepVoltageIncrement
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Tap step increment, in per cent of rated voltage of the power transformer end, per step position. When the increment is negative, the voltage decreases when the tap step increases.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: tculControlMode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specifies the regulation control mode (voltage or reactive) of the RatioTapChanger.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #RatioTapChangerTable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes a curve for how the voltage magnitude and impedance varies with the tap step.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #Reactance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactance (imaginary part of impedance), at rated frequency.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #ReportingGroup
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A reporting group is used for various ad-hoc groupings used for reporting.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #Resistance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Resistance (real part of impedance).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #Seconds
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time, in seconds.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #Susceptance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Imaginary part of admittance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #SvStatus
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: State variable for status.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #SvTapStep
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: State variable for transformer tap step.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #TapChangerControl
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes behaviour specific to tap changers, e.g. how the voltage at the end of a line varies with the load level and compensation of the voltage drop by tap adjustment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #TapSchedule
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A pre-established pattern over time for a tap step.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #Terminal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #TransformerControlMode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Control modes for a transformer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #TransformerCoreAdmittance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The transformer core admittance. Used to specify the core admittance of a transformer in a manner that can be shared among power transformers.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #TransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A conducting connection point of a power transformer. It corresponds to a physical transformer winding terminal. In earlier CIM versions, the TransformerWinding class served a similar purpose, but this class is more flexible because it associates to terminal but is not a specialization of ConductingEquipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #TransformerMeshImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Transformer mesh impedance (Delta-model) between transformer ends. The typical case is that this class describes the impedance between two transformer ends pair-wise, i.e. the cardinalities at both transformer end associations are 1. However, in cases where two or more transformer ends are modelled the cardinalities are larger than 1.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #TransformerStarImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Transformer star impedance (Pi-model) that accurately reflects impedance for transformers with 2 or 3 windings. For transformers with 4 or more windings, TransformerMeshImpedance class shall be used. For transmission networks use PowerTransformerEnd impedances (r, r0, x, x0, b, b0, g and g0).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #TransformerTank
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An assembly of two or more coupled windings that transform electrical power between voltage levels. These windings are bound on a common core and placed in the same tank. Transformer tank can be used to model both single-phase and 3-phase transformers.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #UsagePoint
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Logical or physical point in the network to which readings or events may be attributed. Used at the place where a physical or virtual meter may be located; however, it is not required that a meter be present.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #VerificationAction
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Verification of a switch position or other condition as a switching step

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #Voltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electrical voltage, can be both AC and DC.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #WeatherStation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This represents a source of ambient temperature.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #WindingConnection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Winding connection type.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #WindingInsulation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Winding insulation condition as a result of a test.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: DiagramObjects
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The diagram objects that are associated with the domain object.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: endNumber
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Number for this transformer end, corresponding to the end's order in the power transformer vector group or phase angle clock number. Highest voltage winding should be 1. Each end within a power transformer should have a unique subsequent end number. Note the transformer end number need not match the terminal sequence number.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Names
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All names of this identified object.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: bmagSat
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Core shunt magnetizing susceptance in the saturation region.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SvStatus
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The status state variable associated with this conducting equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ProtectionEquipments
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Protection equipment used to protect specific conducting equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: normallyInService
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TargetingCIMDataObject
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Data objects registered.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PropertiesCIMDataObject
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The single CIM data object in the appropriate dataset context.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: InstanceSet
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Dataset containing the data objects.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: step
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Tap changer position. Starting step for a steady state solution. Non integer values are allowed to support continuous tap variables. The reasons for continuous value are to support study cases where no discrete tap changer has yet been designed, a solution where a narrow voltage band forces the tap step to oscillate or to accommodate for a continuous solution as input. The attribute shall be equal to or greater than lowStep and equal to or less than highStep.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: mRID
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Location
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Location of this power system resource.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Clearances
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All clearances applicable to this power system resource.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: AssetDatasheet
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Datasheet information for this power system resource.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: aliasName
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy. The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: controlEnabled
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specifies the regulation status of the equipment. True is regulating, false is not regulating.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PSREvents
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All events associated with this power system resource.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: OperationalTags
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All operational tags placed on this power system resource.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Assets
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All assets represented by this power system resource. For example, multiple conductor assets are electrically modelled as a single AC line segment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ReportingGroup
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reporting groups to which this power system resource belongs.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: OperatingShare
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The operating shares of this power system resource.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PSRType
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Custom classification for this power system resource.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Measurements
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The measurements associated with this power system resource.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: AdditionalEquipmentContainer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Additional equipment container beyond the primary equipment container. The equipment is contained in another equipment container, but also grouped with this equipment container.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Controls
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The controller outputs used to actually govern a regulating device, e.g. the magnetization of a synchronous machine or capacitor bank breaker actuator.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: OperationalRestrictions
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All operational restrictions for this equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Outages
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All outages in which this equipment is involved.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ProtectiveActionEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Protective action is controlling equipment. This can be direct signals from the control center, or emulation of action done by protection equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: UsagePoints
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All usage points connected to the electrical grid through this equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ltcFlag
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specifies whether or not a TapChanger has load tap changing capabilities.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: neutralStep
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The neutral tap step position for this winding. The attribute shall be equal to or greater than lowStep and equal or less than highStep. It is the step position where the voltage is neutralU when the other terminals of the transformer are at the ratedU. If there are other tap changers on the transformer those taps are kept constant at their neutralStep.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: OperationalLimitSet
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The operational limit sets associated with this equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: LimitDependencyModel
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Limit dependencymodels organized under this equipment as a means for organizing the model in a tree view.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EqiupmentLimitSeriesComponent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Equipment limit series calculation component to which this equipment contributes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: networkAnalysisEnabled
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis. If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: neutralU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Voltage at which the winding operates at the neutral tap setting. It is the voltage at the terminal of the PowerTransformerEnd associated with the tap changer when all tap changers on the transformer are at their neutralStep position. Normally neutralU of the tap changer is the same as ratedU of the PowerTransformerEnd, but it can differ in special cases such as when the tapping mechanism is separate from the winding more common on lower voltage transformers. This attribute is not relevant for PhaseTapChangerAsymmetrical, PhaseTapChangerSymmetrical and PhaseTapChangerLinear.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: normalStep
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The tap step position used in "normal" network operation for this winding. For a "Fixed" tap changer indicates the current physical tap setting. The attribute shall be equal to or greater than lowStep and equal to or less than highStep.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: aggregate
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine. The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: subsequentDelay
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: For an LTC, the delay for subsequent tap changer operation (second and later step changes).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: inService
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: highStep
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Highest possible tap step position, advance from neutral. The attribute shall be greater than lowStep.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: initialDelay
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: For an LTC, the delay for initial tap changer operation (first step change).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TapSchedules
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A TapChanger can have TapSchedules.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TapChangerControl
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The regulating control scheme in which this tap changer participates.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lowStep
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Lowest possible tap step position, retard from neutral.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SvTapStep
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The tap step state associated with the tap changer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JumpingAction
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Jumper action involving jumping operation on this conducting equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: description
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ProtectiveActionAdjustment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The operating condition to the Conducting Equipment is changed when protective action adjustment is activated. For ShuntCompensator or other conducting equipment that operates on discrete values (integer), the values given in float will be rounded.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EquipmentContainer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Container of this equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ContingencyEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The contingency equipments in which this equipment participates.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: GroundingAction
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Action involving grounding operation on this conducting equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Faults
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All faults on this equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BaseVoltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Base voltage of the transformer end. This is essential for PU calculation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ToMeshImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All mesh impedances between this 'from' and other 'to' transformer ends.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: FromMeshImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All mesh impedances between this 'to' and other 'from' transformer ends.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: magBaseU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The reference voltage at which the magnetizing saturation measurements were made.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BaseVoltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Base voltage of this conducting equipment. Use only when there is no voltage level container used and only one base voltage applies. For example, not used for transformers.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: grounded
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: (for Yn and Zn connections) True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseTapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase tap changer associated with this transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Terminals
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Conducting equipment have terminals that may be connected to other conducting equipment terminals via connectivity nodes or topological nodes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rground
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: (for Yn and Zn connections) Resistance part of neutral impedance where 'grounded' is true.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RatioTapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ratio tap changer associated with this transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: magSatFlux
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Core magnetizing saturation curve knee flux level.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xground
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: (for Yn and Zn connections) Reactive part of neutral impedance where 'grounded' is true.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: StarImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: (accurate for 2- or 3-winding transformers only) Pi-model impedances of this transformer end. By convention, for a two winding transformer, the full values of the transformer should be entered on the high voltage end (endNumber=1).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CoreAdmittance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Core admittance of this transformer end, representing magnetising current and core losses. The full values of the transformer should be supplied for one transformer end only.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Terminal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Terminal of the power transformer to which this transformer end belongs.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #IdentifiedObject
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This is a root class to provide common identification for all classes needing identification and naming attributes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: #PowerSystemResource
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A power system resource (PSR) can be an item of equipment such as a switch, an equipment container containing many individual items of equipment such as a substation, or an organisational entity such as sub-control area. Power system resources can have measurements associated.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConductingEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The conducting equipment associated with the status state variable.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Equipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Equipment that should be used in compare.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: AdditionalGroupedEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The additonal contained equipment. The equipment belong to the equipment container. The equipment is contained in another equipment container, but also grouped with this equipment container. Examples include when a switch contained in a substation is also desired to be grouped with a line contianer or when a switch is included in a secondary substation and also grouped in a feeder.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerSystemResource
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The power system resource to which the share applies.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerSystemResources
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power system resources classified with this power system resource type.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConductingEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: ConductingEquipment whose operating condition is changed when this protective action adjustment gets activated.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Equipments
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All equipments to which this restriction applies.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerSystemResource
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power system resource that generated this event.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerSystemResource
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power system resource on which this tag has been placed.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JumpedEquipments
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Conducting equipment is affected when the jumper action connects one or both ends of a jumper to the conducting equipment. If the jumper action involves placing one or both ends of a jumper anywhere along a line segment, you must use the clamp (to get the distance from one terminal), using the explicit relation with clamp. In the case of placing one or both ends of the jumper at a line segment terminal, reference to one or more line segments is sufficient.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Equipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The equipment to which the limit set applies.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The tap changer associated with the tap step state.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConductingEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The conducting equipment of the terminal. Conducting equipment have terminals that may be connected to other conducting equipment terminals via connectivity nodes or topological nodes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerTransformer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Bank this transformer belongs to.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RatioTapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The ratio tap changer of this tap ratio table.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TaggedPSRs
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All power system resources tagged through this clearance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: GroundedEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Equipment being grounded with this operation. In case of placing a ground anywhere along a line segment, you must use the clamp (to get the distance from one terminal), so use the explicit relation with line segment. In all other cases (including placing the ground at a line segment terminal), reference to one or more conducting equipment is sufficient.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A TapSchedule is associated with a TapChanger.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All transformer ends having this core admittance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Equipments
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All equipments associated with this outage.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All transformer ends connected at this terminal.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: FromTransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: From end this mesh impedance is connected to. It determines the voltage reference.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The tap changers that participates in this regulating tap control scheme.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ToTransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All transformer ends this mesh impedance is connected to.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConductingEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All conducting equipment with this base voltage. Use only when there is no voltage level container used and only one base voltage applies. For example, not used for transformers.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All transformer ends having this star impedance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerSystemResource
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Regulating device governed by this control output.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: FaultyEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Equipment carrying this fault.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConductingEquipments
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Protection equipment may be used to protect specific conducting equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Transformer end to which this phase tap changer belongs.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerSystemResources
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All power system resources with this datasheet information.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: IdentifiedObject
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Identified object that this name designates.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: IdentifiedObject
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The domain object to which this diagram object is associated.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Equipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The equipment for which this limit dependency model is organized under.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Equipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Equipment contributing toward the series limit. The reference here is to Equipment rather than a specific limit on the equipment so the grouiping can be reused for multiple limits of different types on the same instance of equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnds
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Transformer ends at the base voltage. This is essential for PU calculation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerSystemResources
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All power system resources used to electrically model this asset. For example, transformer asset is electrically modelled with a transformer and its windings and tap changer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: InstanceSetMember
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Data objects contained in the dataset.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerSystemResources
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All power system resources at this location.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Equipments
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Contained equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TargetObject
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The registered CIM object.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerSystemResource
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The power system resource that contains the measurement.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PropertiesObject
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The CIM object holding the properties of this dataset context. Sometimes properties are not required and only the reference to the registered object is required.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Equipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The single piece of equipment to which to apply the contingency.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerSystemResource
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power system resources which belong to this reporting group.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Equipments
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All equipment connecting this usage point to the electrical grid.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: GenericDataSet
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Contains classes used for generic dataset modelling.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: InfIEC61968
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This package and its subpackages contain informative (unstable) elements of the model, expected to evolve a lot or to be removed, and not published as IEC document yet. Some portions of it will be reworked and moved to normative packages as the need arises, and some portions may be removed. WG14 does not generate documentation for this informative portion of the model.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Base
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Content of the base CIM published as IEC 61970-301.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: InfSIPS
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: System Integrity Protection Schemes (SIPS) (IEC terminology). Other names used are: Remedial Action Schemes (RAS) or System Protection Schemes (SPS).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: DiagramLayout
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This package describes diagram layout. This describes how objects are arranged in a coordinate system rather than how they are rendered.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Operations
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This package contains the core information classes that support operations and outage management applications.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: OperationalLimits
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This package models a specification of limits associated with equipment and other operational entities.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Wires
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An extension to the Core and Topology package that models information on the electrical characteristics of Transmission and Distribution networks. This package is used by network applications such as State Estimation, Load Flow and Optimal Power Flow.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Meas
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Contains entities that describe dynamic measurement data exchanged between applications.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: StateVariables
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: State variables for analysis solutions such as powerflow.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Part303
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Part of the canonical CIM published as IEC 61970-303.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: InfAvailabilityPlans
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Contains the planned schedules for equipment availability, primarily intended for future studies.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: InfIEC61970
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This package and its subpackages contain informative (unstable) elements of the model, expected to evolve a lot or to be removed, and not published as IEC document yet. Some portions of it will be reworked and moved to normative packages as the need arises, and some portions may be removed. WG13 does not generate documentation for this informative portion of the model.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: InfOperationalLimits
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The description of computed or dynamic limits. These classes would likely go into the OperationalLimits package.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: IEC61970
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Top package for IEC 61970.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Core
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Contains the core PowerSystemResource and ConductingEquipment entities shared by all applications plus common collections of those entities. Not all applications require all the Core entities. This package does not depend on any other package except the Domain package, but most of the other packages have associations and generalizations that depend on it.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Protection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An extension to the Core and Wires packages that models information for protection equipment such as relays. These entities are used within training simulators and distribution network fault location applications.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Faults
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The package describes faults that may happen to conducting equipment, e.g. tree falling on a power line.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Contingency
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Contingencies to be studied.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Domain
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The domain package defines primitive datatypes that are used by classes in other packages. Stereotypes are used to describe the datatypes. The following stereotypes are defined: <<enumeration>> A list of permissible constant values. <<Primitive>> The most basic data types used to compose all other data types. <<CIMDatatype>> A datatype that contains a value attribute, an optional unit of measure and a unit multiplier. The unit and multiplier may be specified as a static variable initialized to the allowed value. <<Compound>> A composite of Primitive, enumeration, CIMDatatype or other Compound classes, as long as the Compound classes do not recurse. For all datatypes both positive and negative values are allowed unless stated otherwise for a particular datatype.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: IEC61968
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The IEC 61968 subpackages of the CIM are developed, standardized and maintained by IEC TC57 Working Group 14: interfaces for distribution management (WG14). Currently, normative parts of the model support the needs of information exchange defined in IEC 61968-3, IEC 61968-4, IEC 61968-9 and in IEC 61968-13.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Metering
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This package contains the core information classes that support end device applications with specialized classes for metering and premises area network devices, and remote reading functions. These classes are generally associated with the point where a service is delivered to the customer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Assets
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This package contains the core information classes that support asset management applications that deal with the physical and lifecycle aspects of various network resources (as opposed to power system resource models defined in IEC61970::Wires package, which support network applications).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: InfAssets
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
The package is used to define asset-level models for objects. Assets may be comprised of other assets and may have relationships to other assets. Assets also have owners and values. Assets may also have a relationship to a PowerSystemResource in the Wires model. TODO: The following has been copied from a very old version of draft Part 11, so the references are wrong, but we store the knowledge here to reuse later: "Assets are the basic units which define a physical infrastructure. PowerSystemResources are logical objects meaningful to operations which are constructed from one or more Assets, although PowerSystemResources are not required to specifiy their component Assets. The Asset package is comprosed of several packages. The key concepts of an Asset are as follows:
  • Assets can have names, through inheritance to the Naming package
  • Assets are physical entities which have a lifecycle
  • One or more assets can be associated to create a PowerSystemResource
  • Assets can be grouped (aggregated) with other Assets
  • Assets are typically either 'point' or 'linear' assets, which relate to physical geometry
  • Assets have a close relationship to Work as a consequence of their lifecycle
The following sections describe the packages in the Assets package. The AssetBasics package defines the relationship between Asset and other classes, such as Organization, PowerSystemResource and Document. Point assets are those assets whose physical location can be described in terms of a single coordinate, such as a pole or a switch. Linear assets are those assets whose physical location is best described in terms of a line, plyline or polygon. Asset work triggers are used to determine when inspection and/or maintenance are required for assets".

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Common
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This package contains the information classes that support distribution management in general.
